subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Top-ranked Serena Williams showed no signs of the illness that kept her bedridden last week as she ousted Karolina Sprem, 6-1, 6-2, to reach the quarterfinals of the Paris Open. Williams, after winning the Australian Open, did not practice until Monday and was relieved to get through the first round of this indoor tournament she has won twice. Her second-round match was easier, as Williams took less than an hour to beat Sprem, a qualifier from Croatia, converting her first match point with a forehand return winner down the line. Next up will be the French qualifier Emilie Loit, whom Williams has not met in six years.
